div.div:
CTAP stands for Common Text Analysis Platfrom. It is a web tool for the automatic extraction and analysis of linguistic text characteristics which are commonly associated with linguistic complexity.
CTAP allows for the flexible analysis of texts across languages. Currently, we support English an German and are working on the integration of Dutch, French, and Italian.

h4.a: How to use the Corpus Manager?

div.div:
The corpus manager allows you to upload and maintain your corpora and data sets. You can create, edit, and delete corpora and you can optionally group them into folders, for example to link data sets derived from the same corpus.
After creating a new corpus, you can load, edit, and delete text files by opening the corpus and inserting new texts by a) typing them manually and saving them or b) using the import function to upload one or more files from you computer. You can assign one or more tags to each text to further structure your data collection. These tags have to be predefined in the tag side panel. After creation, all tags will be available across corpora.

h4.a: How to use the Feature Selector?

div.div: The feature selector allows you to generate and manage customised selections of text features. After generating a new feature set, you can select features from the list of available features and add them to your set of selected features. Different features are available for different languages as indicated by the languages tag. It is recommended to ensure that your final feature set contains only features that all share at least one language. You can select features based on their availability for specific languages using the select menu. You can also search for features by entering components of their feature name. To get more information on a specific feature, you can use the information button in the "Details" column. After choosing all features for your feature set, the feature selector will infer for which languages your feature set can be computed by CTAP, i.e. which langauges are shared between all features in the feature set..

h4.a: How to use the Analysis Generator?

div.div: The analysis generator allows you to define analyses by combining a corpus with a feature set and selecting a language for them. You can generate new analyses, delete old analyses, or edit them. While an analysis is running, you can pause and continue it or stop it completely. After an analysis has been completed, you can download the results in form of a csv file to your computer.

h4.a: How to use the visualize analysis results?

div.div: After completing an analysis started using the Analysis Generator, you can visualize features in the result visializer. Select which features you want to integrate to your plot in order to visually inspect your results.
